title: I'm Frustrated with Riot's Balance Team
body:
Expect this to be updated and edited once I realize how bad this is formatted/grammar.

I don't even know where to begin, I'll try to be civil as possible and I ask that you the community do the same. 

I'm tired of being pigeonholed in the jungle into 3/4 different champions, forced to buy one of two choices for smites, and how difficult it is to jungle (low xp, low gold) even though I rarely play jungle. If you screw up a gank, you're behind.

I'm tired of the same champions every game.

I'm tired of {{champion:429}} , {{champion:64}} , {{champion:59}} , {{champion:238}} , etc.

I'm tired of the nerfs to champs that may be problamatic, but wouldn't even be considered OP in most people's minds.

I'm tired of the hypocrisy and being left in the dark.



I honestly don't understand why the changes in patch 5.4 to {{champion:38}}  and {{champion:45}}  were put through when there's so many more issues with mobility (think {{champion:76}} ) and "counterplay" (think {{champion:429}} ).

I shouldn't have to rush the same item every time I go up against {{champion:238}}  if I want to have even a chance of winning.

This is one of my biggest issues, DFG is removed, certain champs that DFG was core on are promised compensation.
What do we get?
{{champion:103}} : mini-rework, insanely broken when the changes first go through on her q
{{champion:45}} : mini-rework, "counterplay adjustments"/nerfs
{{champion:82}} : mini-rework, I don't even know what {{champion:82}}  is supposed to be anymore, a bruiser with no damage/cc?

I'm not high elo, I don't claim to be the best at the game. However, I have played for a while (since season I). I'm entitled to my opinion, and everyone else is as well. Take this for a QQ thread if you wish, however, all I'm asking for is more clarity from the balance/reworks team.

I posted a satircal video as a joke, and it's the top of the boards, not something I thought would happen. As sad as this is, it shows the general consensus of the vocal part of the community at the moment. Take this into consideration.

tl;dr You really should read the whole thing. Basically, asking for clarity on why they're doing what they're doing from the balance/reworks team.

Thanks for reading.

Than you should start writing e-mail to the competent Riot employees in the office and don't give a f'k about boards. I imagine there are a lot of people who wants to improve the game through feedback here, but it is not really working out.

I think the problem is Riot *thinks* they are providing clarity with why they do certain things in patches with the "patch rundowns."

Normally I like the patch rundowns, they are pretty informative and explain why some changes are made with relatively un-baised opinions or reasoning behind the changes that they do... that said, this past one was appallingly 100% baised on their side. They actually brought in live balance guys (frankly I'm surprised they even showed their face, the way a lot of people are upset at that particular department the past month or so) to "explain" why they did what they did, even though what they explained was counter-intuitive of the truth.

One of the more ludicrous things I remember from the rundown was "Sivir has very short range, so beating her up with Caitlyn is a very good option in lane" (paraphrased only slightly)
...
...
...Sivir is like the best counter to Caitlyn. Spell Shield basically negates an entire ability of Caits (traps) which gives her endless mana to continuously spam Boomerang Blade all day, making up for range immediately. She never actually HAS to get in Caits range, lol. Dont forget she can Spell Shield Cait's ult too!
Arguably there are ways for Cait to outplay, but that line just floored me for a second watching that video.

This line came from a "Live Balance Team" member. I lost a LOT of faith right there and then. It's the first time I actually ever felt this way towards the live balance team.

Next up: Kassadin is mentioned. They claim to have balanced him around competitive play, saying he stamps out picks because he's super oppressive. The only example they give of picks stamped out? Lux. A champion that was seen once (to my current knowledge) in the past 2 seasons in competitive play (HotShotGG played her when he subbed midlane at one point.) BTW, he lost. Miserably. And not to a Kassadin either. Logic.

I feel like they just kind of skimmed over the fact that Veigar could potentially achieve the same amount of AP that he can now post Q-rework. Sure he can hit 2 minions at once now, but unless they forgot... the *same amount of minions spawn each wave.* Veigar players have been extremely vocal about this fact, claiming that they could easily get most if not all of the minions per wave anyways when it was a single target ability. So the net gain of AP over the course of the game is literally 0. It's now just *"easier to obtain"* That's where I feel true Veigar players feel cheated, because he received a delay on his E (personally I do agree with this mechanical change. It makes sense; though .75 second may be a touch high), but also R got toned down. So overall, it's basically a full nerf. They called them buffs (9:50 in video).

These are just the primary examples that stood out to me. I did indeed watch the video a couple times to actually go over all the changes in my head and actually think about how they affect the games current live status.


To me, it just feels like they are trying to fix the leaky sink while ignoring the overflowing toilet.

**multiple people are downvoting any criticism posted towards riot pretty much 24/7 so the topic gets buried**

Obviously I can only speak for myself in this case, but I can say I downvote a good bit because there's a difference between criticism and, to be frank, bitching. Specific points and reasoning being the main factor.

This thread specifically admits to being an individual opinion as well, which is a lot more than most can claim. I see a lot of posts that claim their opinion as facts and refuse to believe otherwise. Can't reason with them, so downvote.
You have to admit there is a damn good reason to bitch at this point.

Being upset does not excuse raging for no given reason. And even when reasons are given if you refuse to consider all the possibilities then you're simply being part of the problem. The simple fact is, people will be upset at change. People will *espeically* be upset at change they don't immediately like.

I can't say "wait it'll get better", because people want change *now*. And that's understandable. They don't like how the game is right now but lo and behold the game has more than one or two champs, mechanics aren't as simple to balance as numbers and yes, there will be champs who are all around stronger than others. 

Believe it or not it's changes like these exact ones that keep this game going. There will never be a 'perfect' state for the champions roster, it's impossible. Perfect imbalance is an actual design strategy developed more by the playerbase than anything Riot does.

Change will hurt. Big changes will hurt a lot. I'm completely ok with people being upset, I'm not ok with people refusing to consider other views. But sadly this is the case with *every* patch, the only difference is it's different people. Wait until a big Renekton or Shen change, then I'll be right where you are.

It's not being upset, it's being rightfully pissed off because riot is hypocritical in ANYTHING they do.

They say they listen but they don't at all.

Keeping changes going this way will just run this game to the ground.

Why calmly list the reasons?  Not like Riot is actually listening anymore.  Or they ever were, for that matter.

Nobody complained about Veigar, his pick rates and win rates weren't ridiculous.  Some Asian teams were playing him as a niche support to counter champions like Kalista, a role Annie took up in the NA and EU LCS.  And that was enough for Riot, simply because at some point years ago, they said that if Veigar saw play, he would have to be nerfed.  They tried to disguise it as a rework, but that was just a load of crap.  They didn't rework him; they nerfed him.  Hard.

Sion was a rework.  Do to Veigar what they did to Sion, and people might be a little happier.  Make him virtually unplayable, and you are going to get bitching.  And rightfully so.

Rout logic at its finest.

A big concern I have is that the Balance Team may have a strong echo chamber now. People who are not in that group (us) find the changes out of touch and appear like favoritism towards specific champions by not touching them.

The Balance Team most likely gets feedback from people they talk to in the office, the most vocal posts on reddit/boards, and their metrics. The problem is these is that they only give a slice of the game, and even worse, metrics can be incorrect or manipulated as UPS is now going to have to be dealing with thanks to their Telematics system having bad data due to driver gaming the system so they don't get punished, which is simply a human thing that happens when someone knows they are being monitored.

Riot is going to need to do a lot of work to rebuild trust and improve constructive communication with feedback. When people don't trust you, they view you with animosity. When there is no constructive communication, people begin to resent you.

The last thing that needs to be fixed is the Gameplay Balance forum itself. Threads like these are born out of the mistrust people have for Riot and posting gameplay feedback gets buried under the resentment people currently have for Riot. This isn't constructive for anyone. The Gameplay and Balance forum should be for balance itself, not questioning if riot even listens or if such posts are even worth our time.

Riot will need to make major strides, as will we. This last point will not work without both sides coming to an agreement. If we change and Riot doesn't, these threads will simply bubble up again and it will revert to how it is and the mistrust will only grow stronger. If Riot changes and we don't, it will simply reinforce for them that we just need a place to vent instead of help improve the game and just try and run damage control as they move forwards with their changes.

And I'm not talking about all those "akali op" qq posts, I'm talking about feedback done by Diamond players, or people that have the most games played with certain champions, or well-reasoned, civil posts that bring new ideas that, may be balanced or not, but they are worth at least trying. Hell, PBE is supposed to be a test environment, we are supposed to see there a lot of tentative, experimental changes that may or may not ship to live, but at least they are tested. But nope, PBE is just what RIOT uses to debug what they already want to ship to live, your feedback is pointless for them, they just want you to report bugs.

The only team I can tell they take feedback seriously is the art team. When a certain skin or champion looks ugly or can be improved, they do i.
On the other hand, balance team will ship what they want unless it's proven game-breaking (Lucian's PBE R). And that's why complete disasters like Cassio's rework has been shipped to live even when literally everyone told them it was unnecessary and useless.

> Basically, asking for clarity on why they're doing what they're doing from the balance/reworks team.

btw it's worth saying that they have the legendary, politician-like ability of writing a whole paragraph without actually saying anything.

The Itemization choices is one of the biggest problems in league diversity issues.

E.g.
We have the supposed Poke>Sustain>All-in trinity @ Bot... but the best start is the DBlade start. It's the best item for all ins. Hence the lane trinity favor's all in play over the other 2. So while Mid, Top and Support have plenty of viable *and counter options* for starts ADC has Dblade... Dblade or die. It makes the ADC champ pool real small and that is beyond boring.

I am really, REALLY frustrated over Morde's "compensation".

This dude and me go way back, I HATE to see him receiving a nerf for absolutely NO reason at all. Can we just pretend that we never talked about giving him compensation buff in the first place?

Because this is just ridiculous, dear lord, what in the hell were they thinking when they were tweaking Morde?

Maybe I'm just naive/optimistic, but I do think the game is headed in a good direction long term. The random whack-a-mole champion nerfs are discouraging, as well as the consistent and seemingly misguided nerfs to jungle, sure, but the frequency of reworks and systemic changes, again even though/if they prove problematic in the short term, it *seems to me* at least that the game is on the upswing, and that Riot might actually be working to fix some of the long standing issues that have worked their way into the game over the years. It probably means the game is going to be out of whack for a while, but I think/hope it'll be better in the long run.

In the mean time, the game is still far from unplayable, especially in solo q (you can get away with most things in solo q), there are always ways to adapt; I've changed my main many, many times, and I've learned to play old mains well enough to bypass some of the balance issues.

I respect Riot for all that they've done to make changes, but honestly I feel there not taking a proper direction. For example, yay a new support champion that can zhonyas a whole team, but why can't Taric make plays with his gems? I use to see everyone agree they'd rather see new defined older champions made new again, but now we have a new op champ coming out in place of, maybe instead of buffing the game we're slowly leaving behind we can just get rid of half of the older champs and start over? One thing is for certain, though, you often see the same champions, every match, and what we said might be read or might be ignored, my opinion is simple if you move forward you have to pickup your feet, if you don't pickup your feet then you're hardly moving forward.
